summary: This FBI document details an investigation into Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, who attempted to sell documents related to a civil lawsuit against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000. The document outlines the FBI's plan to conduct a sting operation using an undercover employee to complete the transaction, as Rodriguez's actions constituted obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing plaintiffs in civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Attorney who was contacted by Alfredo Rodriguez attempting to sell documents related to the Epstein case; he reported the illegal demand to authorities and agreed to participate in an FBI sting operation.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Former Epstein employee who was deposed and subpoenaed in a civil case, then attempted to sell documents related to the case to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000, leading to an FBI obstruction of justice investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in a civil lawsuit for which Alfredo Rodriguez possessed documents; Rodriguez was his former employee.

connections.description: Rodriguez was a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, as stated in the document.
Edwards, as an attorney for plaintiffs suing Epstein, deposed and served a subpoena on Rodriguez, who then attempted to sell him documents illegally.
Edwards is an attorney representing four female individuals who are suing Jeffrey Epstein in a civil case.

events.title: Rodriguez contacts Edwards to sell documents
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez contacted attorney Bradley Edwards and offered to sell him documents pertinent to the civil case against Jeffrey Epstein for $50,000.

events.title: FBI documents investigation plan
events.description: FBI documents detail the plan for Edwards to make a consensual call to Rodriguez and introduce an Undercover Employee (UCE) to complete the document transaction, as Rodriguez's actions constitute obstruction of justice.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell documents related to the civil case against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.
Bradley Edwards, representing plaintiffs suing Epstein, identified Rodriguez's demand as illegal and reported it, leading to an FBI investigation for obstruction of justice.
The FBI planned a sting operation where Edwards would introduce an undercover employee to Rodriguez to complete the document transaction.
The document is an FBI administrative report (ELSUR) detailing the investigation and authorization for consensual monitoring as part of the operation.
The case highlights attempts to profit from or obstruct justice in the Epstein civil litigation.
